results.content:
To create and teach the contents making book rater for api is not necessary it is similar to movie rater api,  but also there is no media folder creation even though there is img upload button.  it is wasting time to make the book rater.

taking time for css is not good idea for "framework course." 
 if it is necessary, you should've use bootstrap or bootstrap-vue.

About deploy lectures, "how to know deploy the apps" is necessary to know, but the application in this course is not deserve to deploy to use the app to use in public and quality is not enough to deploy and portfolio either.

results.content: Knowledge is assumed in this course. The author says, "Ok next we will create our routers" etc. A short description of what exactly a router is would have made this a good course. One is coming to this course hoping that this is enough to understand both Vue and DRF.
results.content_html: Knowledge is assumed in this course. The author says, "Ok next we will create our routers" etc. A short description of what exactly a router is would have made this a good course. One is coming to this course hoping that this is enough to understand both Vue and DRF.

results.content: Amazing course very informative and you'll get a good idea on how to use Django with Vue which are both my favourite go to technologies when building web applications.
results.content_html: Amazing course very informative and you'll get a good idea on how to use Django with Vue which are both my favourite go to technologies when building web applications.

results.content: The way of teaching is super awesome but unfortunately the content is less and bad practice on various parts, especially state management and authentication, where the code is copy pasted on every api call. I was expecting state management with Vuex.... I'm a python back end developer for 5 years now, trying to learn vue for front end... and this is the struggling part, do you think i'll be able to make some production ready applications using these kind of logic? even if you make small application make sure you do it right way. That's it.

results.content: This is a great set of lectures- specifically, for someone who wants to find a quick entry into full stack development, combining this w a course on django + postgres, the way this course connects api set up to the vue layer really connects the back + front end dynamic. This may be more obvious to ppl more experienced, but for someone looking to shorten the time in initial learning can get a lot out of this. Both frameworks are top of the line, and the teacher balances the general syntax overview w projects. IMO projects are the gold, thats where you can really skip in learning. I can work backwards from the teachers design process of a project (connecting the back and front end) more quickly than front loading all the info. This teacher executes that subtly.

This may be more obvious to ppl more experienced, but for someone looking to shorten the time in initial learning can get a lot out of this. Both frameworks are top of the line, and the teacher balances the general syntax overview w projects. IMO projects are the gold, thats where you can really skip in learning.
